explains: adj. 紧密的；严谨的；紧密结合着的

sentences.en: Events over the last year have created a close-knit community.
sentences.cn: 过去一年发生的事培养了一个关系紧密的社区。

sentences.en: It was a close-knit community of rectangular, one-story mud-brick houses, joined by narrow lanes and courtyards, finally abandoned about 5000 B.C.
sentences.cn: 它是一座结构紧凑的村庄，有着与狭窄小道和院子相连的矩形单层泥砖房屋，这座村庄最终于公元前5000年被废弃。

sentences.en: He excelled in Bear Stearns's close-knit culture, associates say.
sentences.cn: 同事们说他在贝尔斯登组织严密的文化中逐渐展露头角。
